news.article_text: Readers hoping to buy Blackstone Inc. (NYSE:BX) for its dividend will need to make their move shortly, as the stock is about to trade ex-dividend. Typically, the ex-dividend date is one business day before the record date, which is the date on which a company determines the shareholders eligible to receive a dividend. The ex-dividend date is an important date to be aware of as any purchase of the stock made on or after this date might mean a late settlement that doesn't show on the record date.

news.headline: A Closer Look At IQVIA Holdings Inc.'s (NYSE:IQV) Impressive ROE

Many investors are still learning about the various metrics that can be useful when analysing a stock. This article is for those who would like to learn about Return On Equity (ROE). We'll use ROE to examine IQVIA Holdings Inc. (NYSE:IQV), by way of a worked example.

news.headline: The Story of American TV Shows, From ‘I Love Lucy’ to ‘Stranger Things’
news.summary: The first American television drama was “The Queen’s Messenger,” a filmed play broadcast to sets with 3-inch screens placed throughout the city of Schenectady, N.Y., in 1928.  The first continuing American TV sitcom was the DuMont network’s “Mary Kay and Johnny” in 1947—the same year that also brought the earliest shows geared at children, in “Kukla, Fran and Ollie” and “Howdy Doody.”  This domestic sitcom, starring Lucille Ball as a frustrated housewife and Ball’s then-husband Desi Arnaz as her patient bandleader husband, is the most influential show in TV history, and it isn’t close.

news.headline: Software’s Meltdown Is Classic Doublethink. Don’t Fall for It.
news.summary: Doublethink is a core theme in George Orwell’s “1984”—believing two contradictory ideas at the same time.  Investors are transitioning from the megacap tech giants amid concerns over the pace of artificial-intelligence spending, while buying stocks of companies that rely on the input costs of soaring commodity prices to maintain their profit margins.  For Bank of America’s Vivek Arya, the software selloff has a whiff of the stock market’s DeepSeek meltdown a year ago, when the launch of a cut-priced AI chatbot spooked investors who had piled into U.S. tech stocks.

news.article_text: Readers hoping to buy Blackstone Inc. (NYSE:BX) for its dividend will need to make their move shortly, as the stock is about to trade ex-dividend. Typically, the ex-dividend date is one business day before the record date, which is the date on which a company determines the shareholders eligible to receive a dividend. The ex-dividend date is an important date to be aware of as any purchase of the stock made on or after this date might mean a late settlement that doesn't show on the record date.

news.headline: The Story of American TV Shows, From ‘I Love Lucy’ to ‘Stranger Things’
news.summary: The first American television drama was “The Queen’s Messenger,” a filmed play broadcast to sets with 3-inch screens placed throughout the city of Schenectady, N.Y., in 1928.  The first continuing American TV sitcom was the DuMont network’s “Mary Kay and Johnny” in 1947—the same year that also brought the earliest shows geared at children, in “Kukla, Fran and Ollie” and “Howdy Doody.”  This domestic sitcom, starring Lucille Ball as a frustrated housewife and Ball’s then-husband Desi Arnaz as her patient bandleader husband, is the most influential show in TV history, and it isn’t close.

news.headline: Software’s Meltdown Is Classic Doublethink. Don’t Fall for It.
news.summary: Doublethink is a core theme in George Orwell’s “1984”—believing two contradictory ideas at the same time.  Investors are transitioning from the megacap tech giants amid concerns over the pace of artificial-intelligence spending, while buying stocks of companies that rely on the input costs of soaring commodity prices to maintain their profit margins.
